definition: classics/sacred book/scripture/to pass through/to undergo/to bear/to endure/warp (textile)/longitude/menstruation/channel (TCM)/abbr. for economics 經濟|经济[jing1 ji4]
only used in 濟濟|济济[ji3 ji3]
to cross a river/to aid or relieve/to be of help
used in place names associated with the Ji River 濟水|济水[Ji3 Shui3]/surname Ji

sentences.english: Job growth may also set loose what economists call “shadow demand”.
sentences.chinese: 就業增加也許能刺激經濟學家口中的“影子需求”。

sentences.english: The theoretical breakthrough of plutonomy originated basically from the breakthrough of productivity.
sentences.chinese: 政治經濟學的理論發展根源於生產力的突破。

sentences.english: Well, I'm intending to do Economics
The new standardwas set according to what economists call purchasing power parity.
sentences.chinese: 新的標準是根據經濟學家所說的購買力平價而設定的。

sentences.english: Then how do the mainstream economic theories of the Western world describe the relating of regional economy?
sentences.chinese: 西方主流經濟學說如何描述區域經濟關聯？

sentences.english: To a first approximation, the non-economist's answers violate fundamental economic logic.
sentences.chinese: 大致上，非經濟學家的答案違反了基本的經濟邏輯。

sentences.english: Wall Street economists had expected that the number would drop to 455, 000.
sentences.chinese: 華爾街經濟學家原以爲那個數字會將到45萬5千的。

sentences.english: Lastly, The Economist believes in plain language.
sentences.chinese: 最後，經濟學人信仰平實的語言。

sentences.english: Economists who ignore the recent rise in unemployment deserve to lose their jobs.
sentences.chinese: 忽視最近失業增加經濟學家們，活該丟掉飯碗。

sentences.english: Mr. Wu Jinglian, a renowned economist, concurs with it.
sentences.chinese: 著名經濟學家吳敬璉先生就是這種看法。

sentences.english: Other economists have more confidence that the economy is self-equilibrating.
sentences.chinese: 其它經濟學家們則更加相信經濟可以自我平衡。

sentences.english: The pig is obliged to dig a big pit for the pigeon.
sentences.chinese: 豬被迫爲西方經濟學論文鴿子掘一個大坑。

sentences.english: The Economist’s in-house style guide reads much the same way.
sentences.chinese: 《經濟學人》的內部風格指南也差不多。

sentences.english: The financial sector dominates non-academic employment of professional economists.
sentences.chinese: 在金融部門裏充滿了不從事學術研究的職業經濟學家。

sentences.english: Economists find it devilishly hard to define the “correct value” for a currency.
sentences.chinese: 經濟學家發現給貨幣定義“正確的價值”難於上青天。

sentences.english: In that book, Keynes created the discipline now known as macroeconomics.
sentences.chinese: 在書中，凱恩斯創建了現在所說的宏觀經濟學。

definition: theory/CL:個|个[ge4]/to argue/to take notice of
